definition: geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
Dianjun district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei

sentences.english: China would likely respond by mobilizing the Shenyang Military Region forces and could send forces into North Korea to control refugee flow.

sentences.english: This system had been passed by the technical appraisal of the Logistics Departmant of Military Region.
sentences.chinese: 該系統已通過軍區後勤部的技術鑑定。

sentences.english: He was vice-director of disciplinary examination committee of Guangzhou Military Area.
sentences.chinese: 離休前爲廣州軍區紀律檢查委員會副主任。

sentences.english: Similar incidents occurred in other military commands.
sentences.chinese: 類似的事件也發生在其他的軍區。

sentences.english: The process can differ by branch and by theater of operations.
sentences.chinese: 這種程序在不同的軍區和下屬機構的操作也有所不同。

sentences.english: Leading military officers from the Hebei region attended the opening ceremony in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 2003年開館典禮上，河北軍區領導人悉數出席。

sentences.english: Today we’ll visit an artillery brigade from the Western Military District.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們將參觀俄羅斯西部軍區的炮兵某旅。

sentences.english: One of them is Captain Choe Song-il, the officer in charge of the northern side of the demilitarised zone.
sentences.chinese: 這是負責北部軍區的官員。

sentences.english: The city is a regional command center for the Chinese military, one of seven in the country.
sentences.chinese: 濟南是中國軍隊的地區性指揮中心，七大軍區之一。

sentences.english: The old man used to work in the jin-Cha-Ji Military District.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人曾經在晉察冀軍區工作。

sentences.english: Brigadier Chea Keo is the deputy commander of the Cambodian Military Region.

sentences.english: Ji'nan military region reserve division one three six logistics management section, rank of lieutenant colonel.

sentences.english: Soldiers from the Chengdu Military Command have chosen to walk to the areas with heaviest damage inflicted by the quake last night.
sentences.chinese: 成都軍區官兵已於昨晚徒步進入災情最重的地區。

definition: political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
war zone/combat zone/(military) theater of operations
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
